details.title: Comparison of scheduling algorithms for multifunction radar

authors.affiliation: Dept. of Electron. & Electr. Eng., Univ. Coll. London, London
authors.name: S.L.C. Miranda

authors.affiliation: Dept. of Electron. & Electr. Eng., Univ. Coll. London, London
authors.name: C.J. Baker

authors.affiliation: Dept. of Electron. & Electr. Eng., Univ. Coll. London, London
authors.name: K. Woodbridge

details.abstract: The management of radar resources in a multifunction radar is central to unlocking the potential offered by electronic scanning. Scheduling is an important sub-problem of radar resource management because of the strong correlation between how tasks should be performed, as well as the time available to carry them out and their timeliness. Two scheduling algorithms previously reported in the literature are compared in order to investigate differences in their performance. This provides new insights which may be invaluable in the development of future optimal schedulers. A detailed model of a multifunction radar has been developed to enable comparison using the same operational conditions. The radar is assumed to operate in both 'underload' and 'overload' situations. When not fully loaded (i.e. underload), the two scheduling algorithms perform in significantly different ways. However, in the more important case of overload situations, where there are insufficient radar resources to carry out all necessary tasks, both algorithms provide similar performance. Nevertheless, there still remain differences that require careful understanding when selecting the most appropriate scheduler.

ieee.title: Variable Dwell Time Task Scheduling for Multifunction Radar
ieee.displayText: Hasan S. Mir, Adel Guitouni, "Variable Dwell Time Task Scheduling for Multifunction Radar", Automation Science and Engineering IEEE Transactions on, vol. 11, pp. 463-472, 2014, ISSN 1545-5955.

ieee.title: Adaptive radar scheduling of track updates
ieee.displayText: Peter W. Moo, Zhen Ding, "Adaptive radar scheduling of track updates", Radar Conference (Radar) 2014 International, pp. 1-6, 2014.

ieee.title: Scheduling Beams with Different Priorities on a Military Surveillance Radar
ieee.displayText: Mehmet Rustu Taner, Oya Ekin Karasan, Elif Yavuzturk, "Scheduling Beams with Different Priorities on a Military Surveillance Radar", Aerospace and Electronic Systems IEEE Transactions on, vol. 48, pp. 1725-1739, 2012, ISSN 0018-9251.

ieee.title: Resource manager for MIMO radar
ieee.displayText: Debasish Deb, Ratnajit Bhattacharjee, A. Vengadarajan, "Resource manager for MIMO radar", Radar Conference 2015 IEEE, pp. 71-75, 2015.

ieee.title: Time for a change in phased array radar architectures- part II: The d-radar
ieee.displayText: Gaspare Galati, Francesco Madia, Paola Carta, Emilio G. Piracci, Stefania Franco, Sonia Quattrociocchi, "Time for a change in phased array radar architectures- part II: The d-radar", Radar Symposium (IRS) 2015 16th International, pp. 918-923, 2015.

ieee.title: Radar tasks scheduling for a multifunction phased array radar with hard time constraint and priority
ieee.displayText: Vincent Jeauneau, Frédéric Barbaresco, Thomas Guenais, "Radar tasks scheduling for a multifunction phased array radar with hard time constraint and priority", Radar Conference (Radar) 2014 International, pp. 1-6, 2014.

ieee.title: A New Look at the Radar Detection Problem
ieee.displayText: Emanuele Grossi, Marco Lops, Luca Venturino, "A New Look at the Radar Detection Problem", Signal Processing IEEE Transactions on, vol. 64, pp. 5835-5847, 2016, ISSN 1053-587X.
